storyInfo: Plant hunter Verdant discovers a plant he's never seen before. To protect its existence, he plunges into the sea of flames...

attributes.content: Hey, lad. Whatever you need, just spill it.
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: You're scaring all my customers away with your grim face. I can't do business like this.
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: Yeah?
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: Lad, how about I show you the flowers that have just arrived?
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: Are you getting flowers for your mum or your crush at school?
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: N... Neither.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I saw your recruitment poster.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Do you wish to work here?
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: If you need help...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: You're an Infected?
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: I'm sorry, but I can't hire you.
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: ...It's fine. You're not the only one who's turned me away.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I'm sorry for taking up your time.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Hey, hold on a sec.
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: Why do you want this job?
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: ...I like plants.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: That's a decent reason.
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: I like plants too because they know how to play to their strengths.
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: They can neither talk nor move, but their appeal lies in their colorful flowers and pleasant scents.
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Many plants don't flower and have no scent...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: They deserve our love too, right?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: You're interesting, lad. Hmm.
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: I do have a job in mind that might be suitable for you.
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: Won't be too much human contact, just need to get your hands dirty working with flowers and plants. And it requires you to go dangerous places on the regular.
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: I know this supplier who's on the hunt for plant hunters. Simply put, he needs someone to help him collect rare plants.
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: Wanna give it a shot?
attributes.name: Florist

attributes.content: Whoaagh—
attributes.name: Flustered Mobber

attributes.content: I-Is this a...
attributes.name: Composed Mobber

attributes.content: Trap?!
attributes.name: Flustered Mobber & Composed Mobber

attributes.content: Who are you lot?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: What, us? Whuhh...
attributes.name: Flustered Mobber

attributes.content: ...We're tourists.
attributes.name: Composed Mobber

attributes.content: Yeah, that, we're tourists!
attributes.name: Flustered Mobber

attributes.content: We heard that this old abandoned manor had some smashing scenery, so we came by for a stroll!
attributes.name: Flustered Mobber

attributes.content: For real?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: For real...
attributes.name: Composed Mobber

attributes.content: Something cold is touching me...
attributes.name: Composed Mobber
Flustered Mobber
attributes.content: I feel it too... What is this...

attributes.name: Flustered Mobber
attributes.content: Vines?! Why are they moving?
Many have set their sights on this manor lately. You'd better come clean and tell me why you're here.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Or I'll feed you to these carnivorous plants like those who came before you.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: And who are you...
attributes.name: Composed Mobber

attributes.content: You're asking me?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Stop wasting your breath with him! Just tell him the truth! I can't stand these bloody vines around my neck!
attributes.name: Flustered Mobber

attributes.content: ...We're here looking for thornblooms.
attributes.name: Composed Mobber

attributes.content: Oh? Thornbloom, is it.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: There's not even a single bud here in this manor, let alone thornblooms.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: It's right there under that sculpture! I swear on my granny's life!
attributes.name: Flustered Mobber

attributes.content: Thornbloom is the root of the plant! Just dig it up and you'll see how it got its name.
attributes.name: Flustered Mobber

attributes.content: Turns out it was those weeds...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Is he off looking for thornblooms? Could he be a plant hunter too...
attributes.name: Flustered Mobber

attributes.content: You sodding idiot, look how soft these vines are. They can't choke you.
attributes.name: Composed Mobber

attributes.content: ...Did he bluff me?!
attributes.name: Flustered Mobber

attributes.content: Thornbloom...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: The roots do look like a flower. Thorny and henna-colored.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: According to my boss, its price's gone through the roof in the black market... thanks to its very high medicinal value.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: It doesn't flower and has no scent, but its roots can cure sickness, so people need it.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: They even give it a flower name when it doesn't flower.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Ugh—
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Just as Verdant bends down to pick the thornbloom, he notices a solitary tuft of grass growing beside it.
It's nothing remarkable, but here in this wheat field, it sticks out like a sore thumb.
When the wind blows, the unripe wheat plants all bend to one side.
At that instant, the tuft of grass finally reveals itself to the sun.
What have we here...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Verdant sees the grass and notices his hand that has reached for the valuable thornbloom.
If it weren't for the gust of wind, he probably never would've found this tuft of grass.
All of a sudden, he feels somewhat ashamed.
Hey, kid.
attributes.name: Farmer

attributes.content: Which village are you from?
attributes.name: Farmer

attributes.content: (Wary) What's your business?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: What's your business? You have the face to ask that when you're wandering about my land looking suspicious.
attributes.name: Farmer

attributes.content: How dare you glare at me, huh? Get yourself out of my field. I'm weeding.
attributes.name: Farmer

attributes.content: Weeding?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Upon hearing that, Verdant instinctively glances at the unknown grass behind him.
Knowing he will sound weird and annoying, he speaks anyway...
No...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I'm staying put.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: You brat!
attributes.name: Farmer

attributes.content: Verdant!
God, it IS you... Verdant, mate, how long's it been?
attributes.name: Surprised Man

attributes.content: Oi, Uncle Watson, the scythe doesn't go that high, come on, you could poke someone's...oh, were you having arow?
attributes.name: Surprised Man

attributes.content: You know this boy, Tucker?
attributes.name: Farmer

attributes.content: Of course! We're classmates!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: ...Were classmates.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Not anymore now.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Haha, you haven't changed one bit.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Uncle Watson, you don't get this pissed off, do you... Could be it's just a misunderstanding?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: My classma— Verdant here might come off as a bit intimidating, and he's not good at dealing with strangers. But really, he means no harm.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Okay, then maybe you can talk some sense into him and let him know he's not only a nuisance but also rude.
attributes.name: Farmer

attributes.content: Hurry up and get him off my land! If I go on arguing with him, I'll be too knackered to bicker with my ball and chain tonight!
attributes.name: Farmer

attributes.content: Come in and have a seat. No one's home, so you can relax.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: ...Sure.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I just realized you're a local here.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Wait, what? Just half a minute ago I thought you came all the way here to hang out with me.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Fine. You wouldn't have argued with a farmer over some weeds if you were here to visit me.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: ...Thanks for helping me out just now.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: No big deal... Of course, I'd love some help with my fieldwork report if you're up for it.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: I think I'll sit this one out. I don't want to...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: No, mate, it's fine. I actually didn't think you would say yes. It was just a joke.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Hey...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: I thought you weren't in your right mind trying to save that weed from him.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Now, it sits beautifully in your specimen box.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Tucker, I don't think it's just a weed.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Eh? Isn't this just a millet or some other wild grass... Forget it. As someone who failed the course, I shouldn't argue with one of the top three.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: I'm not saying it isn't...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Hello? Why are you frozen...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: ...It sort of resembles a millet, but it isn't one. I just noticed it.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Look here. Seems like it'd have the same conical kind of inflorescence as bristlegrass, right?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: And the stalk is a bit sedge-like...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: So, it's an undiscovered species?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Can only say I've never seen it. Don't remember reading about it in any books either.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: A new species? That's possible.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Can't believe you crossed a farmer holding a scythe for it when you hadn't the slightest clue what it was. That's not the Verdant I know!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: I don't know why I did it either... I just felt like I had to protect it.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Maybe you did the right thing. What if it IS a new species?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Hah, I was right.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: This is exactly why I wanted your help with my field report!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: You have an eye to tell what's distinctive about the most unremarkable of plants. That's what separates me apart from a top student...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I almost overlooked it too, actually.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: It has no economic value. It's not something a plant hunter needs.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: And so what? What matters is you were sharp enough to find it.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: ...I've got an idea. If we want to know if it's a new species, we can send it to a botanical institute or something for identification.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Identification? Alright... But before that, I've still got work to do.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Got to head back to base.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Yeah, I got the thornbloom. Harvested the full plant intact, and collected a sample of the soil it was growing in too.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Competitors? I think I ran across two... No, they didn't get in my way. It was the other way round, actually...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Other plants of economic value...? No, nothing in particular.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I've sent you the data and photos. If everything's good, I'll be on my way back tomorrow.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: There's a new commission, you said?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: How about I go back and confirm the target with you in person before heading out again?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Even though it's urgent, I... No, I'm not doubting your judgment. I trust you, but I—
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Alright, I understand.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I'll head back the moment I've got the new target plant. Is that alright?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: So, no chance of hitting the institutes?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Nope.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Your boss... sounds like a real pain with the way he talks. Can't you just go back and tell him you didn't find the thing he wanted?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Not unless I don't want this job...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Too bad then.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Being a plant hunter is so much cooler than being stuck in a lab rinsing test tubes and sticking labels on specimens all day! If I were you, I wouldn't trade the job for the world!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: How about this—you don't have to help with my field report if you can take me along plant-hunting once! Pretty please!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: ...Haha.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Sneaking into the target area by following a meticulous plan, fooling the eyes of all, and avoiding danger until reaching the 'final chamber' where the target object lies...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Have you watched that Wrankwood movie that came out last month, the adventure one? The protagonist was hunted down by the natives while looking for treasure in the Sargonian rainforest? That's basically you!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: I—No, I haven't watched...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Thought so.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Tucker, you know I don't really care about those things... I don't work as a plant hunter because I'm into adventures, either.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I do it because I need a livelihood, and I enjoy working with plants.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: It's the best opportunity I've had since catching Oripathy.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: ...Good for you, Verdant.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: I got you. It was the school's mistake to make you drop out because of Oripathy. They've lost a young scholar with a real passion for plants.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: If the professor knew you took on such a risky job just to keep studying plants, he'd definitely regret not pleading your case to the school back then!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Heh... Should I blame him?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Tucker, still remember how we used to cultivate those specimens before?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: ...Aren't you still pretty good at it?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: As he speaks, Verdant closes the lid of the thornbloom's incubator and opens up another specimen case, which is smaller and warmer.
He feels the moisture of the soil within using his fingertip. Then, he gives the glass walls of the case a spritz from his spray bottle.
The nameless grass makes no sound, but he knows it's growing.
Honestly speaking, you looked like a changed man when you were tending to the plants.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Really?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Maybe it's because I don't have to worry about them rejecting me.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Reject? Maybe... But as you know, plants don't always act the way we want either.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Just like those specimens we had in the greenhouse back then. Some barely grew, and some withered early on...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: ...And don't forget the ones that had us going until they started blooming and bearing, just to show us they weren't even the right ones.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: So, you might want to keep your expectations low...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Expectations?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Are you worried that I might be devastated if that grass turns out to be just an ordinary weed?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Mmm.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: I won't. I don't look after it for the elusive possibility of it becoming something extraordinary.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: So...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Tucker, if you saw it growing next to the crops, what would you do?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I'd pull it out, of course. It doesn't even fit to be used as compost...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Right... That was what I used to think for a long time.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: But at that time, I thought I was someone important, like the crop. I never imagined one day I'd have nowhere left to go.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Now, I'm even more useless than compost... At least, compost can still be kept on the field.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Verdant...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: It's alright, Tucker. I'm doing pretty well now, right?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I've thought it through—I don't really expect it to be a new species.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I just think that... it deserves a little place of its own.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: When you think about it, you'll realize that it hardly needs anything at all.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Soil, water, and sunlight... That's it. Enough to sustain its growth.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Verdant suddenly feels an urge to ask the nameless grass some questions.
What's your name?
Do you long to be noticed?
Are... Are you scared of being rejected too?
Little grass...
...You'd much rather go back to the vast field than be stuck in a little specimen case, right?
'...You'd better go. Now.'
'Get out of here!'
It's...
'You saw it too. It was a unanimous decision by the school board.'
'You should prioritize your health over learning here, right?'
'...True, they're not contradictory, but we have to consider the welfare of the students and staff here.'
'That's out of the question. The school would never let you have a whole dorm room just to yourself.'
Alright. I'll leave, then.
'College graduate? We just need someone who can bring in customers... You're an Infected? Well, that won't do.'
'We don't hire the Infected as typists. Oh, you can work from home? You promise your efficiency won't be affected? Dream on!'
'Hey, you, keep away from my shop! Don't let me catch you around here again! The quarantine, that's where you belong!'
'Sorry, we can't hire you.'
Alright. I'll leave, then.
'All these straw hats and sandals. You haven't sold a single one?'
'Trust me, I've asked around! No buyers are willing to take them! Tsk... Even the village head is avoiding us now.'
'Maybe we can try at a nomadic city next...'
'That's quite a good idea, actually. I'll head to the market tomorrow and bring with me the premium cotton cloth Mother left behind. Maybe we can get a second-hand cart with it!'
'And take my silver bracelet too! There has to be a way... We have to let him stay. No matter what, he's still our son...'
Maybe I should go. Even if there's no turning back to my old life, I have to pull myself together.
But... where can I go?
Huh?
...God, what a racket.
Fine, I'll go. Stop trying to kick me out! I can survive without you!
'Verdant—'
I know what to do! Just shut up!
Was it a dream...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: The grass... is still there.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Eh? There seems to be a new bud sprouting here.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I know some plants will experience a growth spurt when they sense a drastic change in their environment.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Little grass, do you feel safe inside this specimen case?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Hey, Verdant!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Open up! Don't tell me you're still sleeping!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Tucker? Why are you here?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: ...WHY AM I HERE?!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Oh, please. Didn't you promise to take me to experience plant hunting yesterday?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Wasn't that a joke?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Let's move! Many hands make light work!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: We can hit the botanical institute sooner too, right?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Can't believe you're still thinking about that... It doesn't harm to do the identification, I guess.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: ...Fine, let's do this together.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: You aren't helping by leaving your footprints everywhere we've passed by.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Yahoo—
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: How's that? I can easily jump to the other roof—whoawhoawhoaaahh ohgodhelpmeMum!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Careful!
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Phew, that was close. Luckily, it was the tile that fell and not me.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Thanks for catching me, Verdant...? Wait, why is the 'Scarecrow' here?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Unlike you, I'll climb up from the ground.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Don't need to thank the 'Scarecrow'. It probably just didn't want you to cause a ruckus that would alert all the villagers.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Nice work! That's the Verdant I know from school.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: You are a working adult now. Can't you be more tolerant of your friend? How immature!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: No dilly-dallying, Tucker. Jump in through that chimney.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: What? The chimney?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Wait, shouldn't we knock before going in? Waitwaitwaitwait, why is your 'Scarecrow's' pushing me—
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Total silence.
Well?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: The 'Scarecrow' caught me. I guess it was a safe landing?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: ...I didn't scream out loud. That took me a lot of effort, you know!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Good for you. Coming down.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Phew... Can you hear it? My heart's pounding like a sledgehammer!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Can't believe I just reached the 'final chamber' with a plant hunter and had my hands on a 'mysterious ancient seed'!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: We just took the target object from an empty hut... Don't exaggerate things.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Well, this isn't as exciting as I imagined it would be!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: I mean, where was the sleuthing part? We went in, we grabbed it, we got out... Is that it? Way too easy!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: This seed doesn't look rare either...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: I think it was left here by the previous agent.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Agent?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Plant hunters don't just handle dangerous missinos There's simple work like this too, which involves collecting an object at a designated location.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: ...Like a Messenger?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: I heard the very first batch of plant hunters were Messengers specializing in international spice trade.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Being a plant hunter doesn't sound cool anymore...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Time to head back to base. I need to debrief with my boss. I hope he won't give me any more assignments.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Tucker, I reminded you to clean your shoes after we stepped through the mud.
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Eh? I did. Look, they are as clean as a whistle.
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Then, whose footprints are these... Why do they look so similar to the ones near the base?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Can't be...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Eh? Excuse me? Why are you running—
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Move! We're running out of time!
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: From a distance, Verdant spots thick smoke rising from the base.
With all the strength he has, he sprints. The pungent smell of the smoke makes it hard for him to breathe.
The uneasy feelings before have taken form in the fire before his eyes.
Ugh...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Well, look what he's brought us... A surprise!
attributes.name: Delighted Mobber

attributes.content: We've got a packet of square sunflower seeds here! That'll make us a pretty penny!
attributes.name: Delighted Mobber

attributes.content: Enough. Shut it.
attributes.name: Composed Mobber

attributes.content: Damage all the emergency communicators in the base. Take whatever's useful.
attributes.name: Composed Mobber

attributes.content: We must get out of here before he wakes up.
attributes.name: Composed Mobber

attributes.content: Don't...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Why...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Why...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Mum, should we clear the weeds in the field?
'Yes. They'll impede the growth of the crops.'
Can we just move them away from the crops? Like, our courtyard?
I want to know what they look like when they grow up.
'Hmm... Good idea.'
'They might grow into wheat, or maybe corn.'
'I hear a very long time ago, weeds were no different from the grains.'
...What if we can't eat them?
What if they grow ugly flowers and turn really smelly? That'd be awful!
'Haha! Have you become old enough to be bothered by these things? Don't worry—'
'They'll still have their own worth.'
Verdant! Were the two guys that ran off holding the thormbloom incubator?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: ...Are you injured?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Little...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Should I go after them?
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: Check on... the grass...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: T—The grass? Please tell me you won't go inside...
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: No! The fire's getting out of control! Don't go in, Verdant!
attributes.name: Tucker

attributes.content: That grass... I still haven't taken it to the institute...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I still haven't given it a name...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: It survived in the field even when nobody tended to it...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: It shouldn't be pulled out or be devoured by flames...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: It shouldn't be chased away or forgotten...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: It is just trying to survive...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Thank god... It's still here, my specimen case... They didn't take you away...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: I guess being inconspicuous is your strength...
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Verdant wipes off the ash on the glass case, eager to make sure the grass is safe.
...Huh?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Is this.. that tuft of grass?
attributes.name: Verdant

attributes.content: Lit up in the fire, Verdant beholds the sight within the case clearer than anything.
His grass can't handle the sharp rise in temperature well.
Its millet-like leaves are wilted, and its sedge-like stem is drooped. But the part that resembled bristlegrass is actually blooming.
Is that its flower? Did the fire cause the transformation? Verdant isn't sure.
No one can know for sure it is a kind of flower when they see its delicate tendrils for the first time.
The plant doesn't look like it is blooming at all with its wilted leaves and drooped stem.
But Verdant is certain that the grass is not millet, sedge, or any other kind of grass he's encountered before.
